text: Robert W. "Bob" Gore (April 15, 1937 â€“ September 17, 2020) was an American engineer, scientist, inventor and businessman. He was born Salt Lake City, Utah. Gore led his family's company, W. L. Gore & Associates. He was known for his invention of Gore-Tex. Gore died on September 17, 2020 in Newark, Delaware from cancer at the age of 83.Gore-Tex technology inventor Robert W. Gore dies at 83 ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Delaware Category:Engineers from Utah Category:American inventors Category:Businesspeople from Salt Lake City, Utah Category:Scientists from Utah
title: Robert W. Gore
